spaces.focus: Middle-phase modeling: make the space do the heavy lifting.

set-theory.definition: U = set of all guardrail-observable states.
set-theory.subset: S ⊆ U = states satisfying guardrails-begin invariants.
set-theory.operator: F: U → U = guardrails-middle transformer per iteration.

topology.definition: τ on U such that (U, τ) is a topological space; opens capture observability neighborhoods.
topology.property: S is closed under τ (limits of safe states remain safe).

metric.definition: d: U×U → ℝ≥0 measuring divergence of telemetry/control-plane hashes.
metric.property: (U, d) is complete after end.xml archival (Cauchy sequences converge in continuum bindings).

normed.definition: ‖x‖ = d(x, 0) compatible with inner product when defined.
normed.space: (B, ‖·‖) is Banach: closure of enforcement packages under middle-phase composition.

hilbert-hook.space: H ⊆ B with inner product ⟨·,·⟩; see lib/engine/hilbert.xml.
hilbert-hook.property: Safe region C ⊆ H is nonempty, closed, and convex.
hilbert-hook.projection: P_C: H → C defined via Hilbert projection theorem.

measure.sigma-algebra: Σ on U induced by observability; (U, Σ, μ) probability space of incidents.
measure.integrability: Incident rates are μ-integrable; expectation constraints form linear functionals.

lattice.monotone: G: L → L monotone closure operator; fixed points are stable policy sets.
